Constructor Detail

ArgumentParser

public ArgumentParser(String[] args)
Constructs a new ArgumentParser using a given set of arguments. Usually the arguments given will be from the main function.

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments to be parsed.
Method Detail

initialize

private void initialize()
Reads in all command line arguments.

loadSettings

private void loadSettings()

processArgument

private int processArgument(int argNumber)
Takes a given argument represented by its respective number in the array of arguments and figures out what to do with it. The number of arguments parsed including the current one is returned so the loop can restart at the next intelligent argument.

Parameters:
argNumber - The number of the argument to be processed with respect to the argument array.
Returns:
the number of arguments that were processed

processSocketTimeout

private void processSocketTimeout(int argNumber)
Parameters:
argNumber - the command line argument that contains the socket timeout

processServerSocketTimeout

private void processServerSocketTimeout(int argNumber)
Parameters:
argNumber - the command line argument that contains the server socket timeout

processPortArgument

private void processPortArgument(int argNumber)
Processes a port argument. Prints an error if the port was invalid or nonexistant.

Parameters:
argNumber - the argument that contains the number of the port.

getListenPort

public int getListenPort()
Returns:
the port the proxy should listen on

isListenPortSet

private boolean isListenPortSet()

isVerbose

public boolean isVerbose()
Returns:
whether or not to display verbose debugging statements

isProxyMode

public boolean isProxyMode()
Returns:
whether or not Crunch is running in proxy mode or standalone file mode

setListenPort

public void setListenPort(int i)
Sets the port to listen on in proxy mode. Valid ports are in the range from 0 to 65535.

Parameters:
i - the port to listen on in proxy mode

setProxyMode

public void setProxyMode(boolean b)
Parameters:
b - whether or not to run in proxy mode

setVerbose

public void setVerbose(boolean b)
Parameters:
b - whether or not to display verbose debugging messages

getServerSocketTimeout

public int getServerSocketTimeout()
Returns:
the time the server socket should wait for data before timing out

getSocketTimeout

public int getSocketTimeout()
Returns:
the time ordinary sockets should wait before timing out

setServerSocketTimeout

public void setServerSocketTimeout(int i)
Parameters:
i - the amount of time the server socket should use to wait for connections to be established.

setSocketTimeout

public void setSocketTimeout(int i)
Parameters:
i - the amount of time sockets should wait when performing io operations.
